intro: Persicaria milletii, commonly known as redroot pigweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its smooth, often reddish stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are greenish-white with prominent stamens. Persicaria milletii is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
